skills.name: composable-query-layer
skills.definition: Three modes of intent expression: Natural Language Query (agents/power users), Structured Navigation (humans, click-to-zoom), Saved Recipes/Dashboards. URL encodes query state.

skills.name: primitive-library
skills.definition: Taxonomy of UI primitives: Atomic (Icon, Badge, Text), Entity (ProjectNode, ServiceNode), Relationship (edges with styles), Container (GraphCanvas, EntityList), Composite (DependencyExplorer, HealthDashboard).
layers: Layer 3: Relationship (edges with styles by type)
skills.composition_rules: Few entities + relationships → Graph. Many entities → List. Single entity → Detail. Mixed → Dashboard.

skills.name: ai-arena-debate
skills.definition: Multi-model AI debate system for hypothesis validation. Claude, Gemini, GPT debate in structured rounds until consensus or deadlock.

skills.name: agentic-tool-hierarchy
skills.definition: Compositional hierarchy for Claude Code tools: Slash Commands (primitives) → Sub-agents (parallelization) → MCP Servers (external integrations) → Skills (lifecycle managers). Each level can orchestrate lower levels.
key_rules: Start with Slash Command, escalate only when needed
Sub-agents for parallelization and context isolation ONLY
MCP Servers for external integrations ONLY
Skills manage problem lifecycles, not single tasks
Skills can orchestrate all lower levels
anti_patterns: Graduating single task to Skill (wrong: Skill for 'create work tree'; right: Skill for 'manage work trees')
Using MCP to orchestrate Skills (inverted hierarchy)

skills.name: custom-model-training
skills.definition: Progression from API+RAG → Fine-tuning → Custom Training → Hybrid Intelligence. Nanochat-style $100-1000 custom models for domain-specific understanding.

model_stack.routing_layer: Decides model based on sensitivity, domain specificity, capability required
model_stack.domain: Fine-tuned or custom for company-specific concepts

skills.value_proposition: AI that UNDERSTANDS your business, not just retrieves info about it

skills.name: graph-service-federation
skills.definition: Cross-project queries with unified data spine. Project becomes zoom level, not container. Federation merges data with deduplication and conflict resolution.

concepts.name: VISLZR
concepts.definition: Composable Operating Surface - the unified interface for CommandCenter where the project boundary becomes a zoom level, not a container. Users and agents interact with single surface that composes any view.

concepts.name: ComposedQuery
concepts.definition: Parse result structure for intent resolution: entities (what to fetch), filters, relationships, presentation hints, timeRange.

concepts.name: Affordance
concepts.definition: Actions agents can take: trigger_audit, create_task, open_in_editor, drill_down. Part of QueryResult returned to agents.

concepts.name: LLMGateway
concepts.definition: Unified interface for multiple LLM providers (Claude, Gemini, GPT) with cost tracking and observability via LiteLLM.

concepts.name: AI Arena
concepts.definition: Multi-model AI debate system for strategic research and hypothesis validation. Uses LLMGateway to orchestrate Claude, Gemini, GPT debates.

concepts.name: HypothesisValidator
concepts.definition: Hypothesis-specific debate workflow integrated with Task system. Stores evidence in KnowledgeBeast, publishes progress via NATS.

concepts.name: nanochat-style training
concepts.definition: Custom LLM training at $100-1000 cost following Karpathy's nanochat approach: tokenization → pretraining → midtraining → SFT → evaluation.

relationships.description: VISLZR queries Graph-Service for entity and relationship data
VISLZR composes primitives to render views
Query layer powers VISLZR intent resolution
AI Arena uses LLMGateway for multi-model debates
Hierarchy informs what level bootstrap components target
Custom models complement RAG with intrinsic understanding
